snippet: After touring Nelson Mandela’s prison cell on Robben Island, President Obama lauded Mr. Mandela, South Africa’s first black president, for his courage and refusal to yield to injustice.
abstract: Pres Obama visits prison cell in which Nelson Mandela was held at Robben Island in Cape Town and later invokes Mandela's legacy in speech he delivers at University of Cape Town.

byline.contributor: Declan Walsh contributed reporting from Johannesburg.

lead_paragraph: After touring Nelson Mandela’s prison cell on Robben Island, President Obama lauded Mr. Mandela, South Africa’s first black president, for his courage and refusal to yield to injustice.

headline.main: Obama Visits Prison Cell That Helped Shape Modern South Africa
headline.print_headline: Obama Visits Prison Cell That Helped Shape Modern South Africa
